intro: Orthocarpus lacerus, commonly known as the narrowleaf orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in grasslands and forest edges. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
